creator: ajslater@attbi.com
text:
Nightly build: 2002-08-20

Loading test plans with more than 10-15 nodes takes a long time.
I think a test plan with 60 or so nodes would not be an uncommon use for JMeter.
A 60 node plan takes minutes to load the GUI elemnents on a sub 1 Ghz processor,
and then (once you click 'run') more minutes to compile the testplan for each of
the remote clients.

Slow sucks. Could we load the GUI hierarchically? Only load gui elements that
are expanded/opened?

Could we compile the test-plan once only and cache it, sent the compiled plan to
the clients. Invalidate the cache if the plan changes at all? Also, we could
serialize the compiled test, store it with the same prefix name as the JMX, like
compiled python scripts.

Do these sound like reasonable considerations?

creator: mstover1@apache.org
text:
I loaded a 3 MB .jmx file in 6 seconds with the current code on a 2Ghz pentium 4
machine.  That seems pretty good.
